result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon R Ealy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon R Ealy appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Brandon R Ealy.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Toran is newly retained and needs time to meet with his client.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 095819,
Payable Number: 1037531,
Receipt Number: 22RP040437,
Amount: $20.00

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon R Ealy in court. Attorney Mike Fuentes appears as a friend of the court on behalf of the defendant. Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/4/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 10/04/2022@1pm
